text.0: to rudra bring these songs whose bow is firm and strong the selfdependent god with swiftlyflying shafts.
text.1: the wise the conqueror whom none may overcome armed with sharppointed weapons may he hear our call.
text.2: he through his lordship thinks on beings of the earth on heavenly beings through his high imperial sway.
text.3: come willingly to our doors that gladly welcome thee and heal all sickness rudra in our families.
text.4: may thy bright arrow which shot down by thee from heaven flieth upon the earth pass us uninjured by.
text.5: thou very gracious god hast thousand medicines inflict no evil on our sons or progeny.
text.6: slay us not nor abandon us o rudra let not thy noose when thou art angry seize us.
text.7: give us trimmed grass and fame among the living preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
